pullRequest.body:
Add supporting lemmas for graphs free of matchings in preperation for Tuttes theorem

---

@YaelDillies, there are still open conversations above. Have they been dealt with? (Probably best to try to get things marked as resolved before `maintainer-merge`.)

Sorry, it's incredibly painful to scroll through the comments on a PR from the mobile app. And indeed all the comments were resolved (I think it's a reasonable assumption that all the comments I've made have been addressed when I maintainer merge a PR, else I would have complained).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10352484835/job/28653193281)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10352484835/job/28653194308)

```suggestion
  consider a graph being free of just matchings, because any non-trivial graph has those.
```

```suggestion
def IsMatchingFree (G : SimpleGraph V) := âˆ€ M : Subgraph G, Â¬ M.IsPerfectMatching
```

```suggestion
lemma exists_maximal_isMatchingFree [Fintype V] [DecidableEq V]
```
This is a general property of monotone predicates. Maybe Peter's #14721 will help here?

I don't think it even needs monotinicity. It's more a specialization of generic facts to a Fintype. I'm not quite sure if that's an idiomatic statement. I was looking at Data.Fintype.Order for a landing place, but I see recently stuff in the Fintype namespace has been deprecated. Any thoughts on where this should go? 

As far as I understand Peter's work I don't think it's overlapping.

> I was looking at Data.Fintype.Order for a landing place, but I see recently stuff in the Fintype namespace has been deprecated

Uh, what things were deprecated?

[This stuff](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/604cb3610ee4c147dd3ef1966d0505c57cabbf0c/Mathlib/Data/Fintype/Order.lean#L215) So mostly my question is, should this be here, and if yes should it be in the Finite or Fintype namespace?

(Currently working on following up on the comments below:))
I commited something that I think makes some sense, but I'm very open to a better spot to put it.

Oh, that's simply because some lemmas don't need constructive finiteness to be stated, so they shouldn't use constructive finiteness to be stated. Put yours in the namespace`Fintype` or `Finite` depending on whether they assume `Fintype` or `Finite`

```suggestion
lemma IsMatchingFree.mono {G G' : SimpleGraph V} (h : G â‰¤ G') (hmf : G'.IsMatchingFree) :
```
Indentation is wrong here
Fixed

```suggestion
    hc.ne <| hb.2 _ (le_trans hb.1.1 (le_of_lt hc)) hc' (le_of_lt hc)âŸ©
```

```suggestion
  exact Fintype.exists_maximal h
  
```
@apnelson1, thoughts?

This should probably be phrased with `âˆƒ b, a â‰¤ b âˆ§ Maximal p b` (from #14721) as the conclusion. The particular `gt -> Not p` version in the statement is then `Maximal.not_prop_of_gt`. 

Also the name should be something like `exists_le_maximal`.

```
lemma Finite.exists_ge_minimal {Î±} [Finite Î±] [PartialOrder Î±] {a : Î±} {p : Î± â†’ Prop} (h : p a) :
    âˆƒ b, b â‰¤ a âˆ§ Minimal p b := by
  obtain âŸ¨b, âŸ¨hba, hbâŸ©, hbminâŸ© :=
    Set.Finite.exists_minimal_wrt id {x | x â‰¤ a âˆ§ p x} (Set.toFinite _) âŸ¨a, rfl.le, hâŸ©
  exact âŸ¨b, hba, hb, fun x hx hxb â†¦ (hbmin x âŸ¨hxb.trans hba, hxâŸ© hxb).leâŸ©

lemma Finite.exists_le_maximal {Î±} [Finite Î±] [PartialOrder Î±] {a : Î±} {p : Î± â†’ Prop} (h : p a) :
    âˆƒ b, a â‰¤ b âˆ§ Maximal p b :=
  Finite.exists_ge_minimal (Î± := Î±áµ’áµˆ) h 
```
I think that `Finite` makes more sense here than `Fintype`. See [here](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Fintype/Lattice.html#Finite.exists_max), for instance.
Fixed:)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Combinatorics/SimpleGraph/Matching): Add matching free graphs
